result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Bernard Peoples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Bernard Peoples

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Antonio Bernard Peoples
Current: 4858 N. 45th St., Milwaukee, WI 53218-4405 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2015)
Prior: 7066 N 43rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Antonio Bernard Peoples in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Antonio Bernard Peoples in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 21.
As to count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 in the House of Correction, with credit for 87 days time served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders the defendant to pay $674.00 to House of Correction for GPS monitor, strap and charger.
Court orders the payment of court costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges and DNA surcharge.
Court orders defendant to submit DNA sample and pay costs.
Court orders that all costs, assessments, surcharges and restitution by paid within 1 year, 5-15-2015, or a civil judgment shall be entered.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief signed and filed.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Antonio Bernard Peoples not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.

Defendant Antonio Bernard Peoples in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Antonio Bernard Peoples in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Antonio Bernard Peoples
Current: 7066 N 43rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 03-08-2014)
Prior: 949 N 9th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
